title.narrative: Normative and policy frameworks are promoted and adapted in line with international standards and institutions have the commitment, knwoledge and capacities to legislate, plan, implement, and monitor policies to adress VAWG, GBV and HP

description.narrative: The UNWOMEN office in Niger will conduct a quantitative and qualitative assessment of the application of the normative framework on EVAWG and conduct a social mobilization to advocate for application of the legislative and political texts and to transform them into action; the civil society organizations will be reinforced to support the advocacy actions to protect women and girls from violence. The office will also reinforce the national and local institutions on GRB for adequate budget allocation to end violence, put in place local initiative for social norms and harmful practices changing and putting in place holistic services for survivors of violence.
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: SN_DRF
Legislative and policy frameworks in line with international human rights standards relating to violence against women and girls and harmful practices are in place and translated into plan.

description.narrative: Disseminate informations and knowledges on policies, strategies, legislations, statistics among key actors , strengthening their capacities in promoting women's rights and advocacy

title.narrative: Niger has adopted laws and policies on VAWG/SGBV/HP that adequately respond to the rights of all women and girls, including access to SRHR, are evidence-based and in line with international norms and standards ( Draft of law on EVAWG).
